posts.post_content: Why is she not getting 5 stars? She is a knight ([Knight Exemplar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight Exemplar)), makes tokens ([Elspeth Tirel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elspeth Tirel)) a 3/4 body and has battlecry, what more do you need for a WW deck. She is a decent top deck with the exclution of [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan) and [Baneslayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer). Plus she is a baby [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan)...

Posted By: Wizard-of-the-Toast (1/29/2011 2:29:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think the reason why she isn't wearing much isn't because of fanservice, but rather because the Auriok don't really wear that much--if you look at [Accorder Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Accorder Paladin), or the people on [Frantic Salvage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frantic Salvage) from the same set, they're not wearing full armor, or even shirts.   
  
As for her as a card, her abilities are quite good--when she attacks, just by herself she's basically attacking with seven points of damage. Now imagine her with [Honor of the Pure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honor of the Pure) of [True Conviction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=True Conviction) (or worse, both--that could kill a player if they, for some inexplicable reason, don't block). She's an amazing card with so much potential.
posts.html:

As for her as a card, her abilities are quite good--when she attacks, just by herself she's basically attacking with seven points of damage. Now imagine her with Honor of the Pure of True Conviction (or worse, both--that could kill a player if they, for some inexplicable reason, don't block). She's an amazing card with so much potential.

posts.post_content:
@superwill:  
  
You kinda have the right idea. If you do what you said and [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) after she makes the tokens, then the tokens and the [White Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=White Knight)s become her, and then nothing happens because the attack triggers have already passed. you would be swinging for at least 15 damage though. (not sure about the layering with battle cry and changing the creatures.)   
  
But, if you [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) before attacking though, the knights also become her, and you get 6 different 4/1 soldiers and 3 5/4's, and that's pretty nuts-oh. 35 damage seems pretty gewd to me.   
  
If you have another [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) in hand next turn, well, then...... wow.
posts.html:

But, if you Mirrorweave before attacking though, the knights also become her, and you get 6 different 4/1 soldiers and 3 5/4's, and that's pretty nuts-oh. 35 damage seems pretty gewd to me.

If you have another Mirrorweave in hand next turn, well, then...... wow.

posts.post_content:
Just checking, this has good synergy with Mirrorweave right? Say for example I had Hero of Bladehold and two White Knights out and was attack with everything. She would then spawn two soldiers. I then cast Mirrorweave and all four other creatures also become Hero of Bladehold and each spawn another two soldiers.  
  
So what you have from your original three creatures is now 13 creatures, and a total of 5 instances of battlecry from having 5 hero of bladeholds? A.k.a 83 damage if I've done my quick maths right?  
  
Would this actually work? Or does it not work because these abilities only trigger when you tap to attack and there's no way to do it in the right order?  
  
Thanks to any willing to reply.
